intro: Carduus defloratus subsp. medius, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring a robust stem covered in stiff, hairy hairs. The plant produces yellow composite flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster, with numerous small florets. Its leaves are deeply lobed and have a rough, serrated texture. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and wastelands.
